events.name: BigQuery live demo
events.description:
A live demo of BigQuery features for a practical introduction, including the use of your own data set or visualization tools like Tableau.

BigQuery is probably the most unique and versatile toolset of the Google Cloud Platform, useful to answer repeated or ad-hoc questions on large and joined datasets from your servers logs to Call Detail Records of a large telecom company. The goal of this talk to give you enough information and a burning desire to try it with your own data!

events.name: Orchestrating Docker containers with Kubernetes
events.description: Hands-on introduction to Kubernetes with demos, from local virtual machines to the cloud.

events.name: Meet our special guests from Google and Nordcloud!
events.description:
Welcome to the third Google Cloud Platform meetup, this time with special guests: Otso Juntunen, Head of Google Cloud Platform, Nordics and Ilja Summala, Group CTO, Nordcloud.

Otso from Google will speak about infrastructure at Google scale, how Google Cloud Platform came to be and how Google's immense knowledge about running highly scalable and available services has influenced the design of GCP components.

Ilja from Nordcloud will speak about real-life technical experiences using cloud solutions. Ilja has worked with this at many of the hottest startups and largest organisations in Europe.

Please join us, this is a great opportunity to meet those guys in an informal event with pizza and soft drinks!

events.name: Cloud OnBoard - Oslo
events.description:
We would like to share and remind you about Cloud OnBoard - Oslo. This is a free full-day instructor-led enablement and training event that will provide you with a step-by-step technical introduction to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Through a combination of instructor-led presentations and technical demonstrations, you will learn how to get started with Google App Engine, Datastore, Storage, Container Engine, Compute Engine and Network, Big Data and Machine Learning.

Cloud OnBoard has been designed for IT Managers, Systems Engineers and Operations professionals, Developers, Solution Architects and modern business leaders who are exploring cloud solutions or are new to Google Cloud Platform. Leveraging the GCP Fundamentals course, the event will provide you with the technical training you need to get started as well as access to tips and tricks, industry best-practice and questions and answers from the GCP team.

More info: https://cloudplatformonline.com/2017-OnBoard-Oslo.html

events.name: Chatbots: Behind the avatar- Let me see you stripped (down to the code)
events.description:
by Lotta Nordling, Principal engineer at Computas AS

Description

Chatbots are the new “it” – again. We have created Ada - a chatbot for Computas HR department, based on Google Cloud technology. We take a peek at chatbots now and then, some of the backend technology they use, why they (still) can be so stupid and hints on how to avoid pitfalls when designing a bot. We demonstrate Ada and take a deeper dive into her code.

Keywords: chatbots, google, ai, dialogue design

About Lotta Nordling

Computer linguist and Principal engineer at Computas with experience from 11 years in the IT business, with my main experience from semantic technology, chatbots (old and new), search, NLP, AI, databases, webservices. I’m no front end person, and I’m not impressed by cool new frameworks and libraries for their own sake. I’m primarily a problem solver, and like to go to the core of a solution.

During my spare time I nourish my creative side by designing LARPs and geek jewellery (memory card necklaces etc). I’m also a mother, vegetarian and passionate about environmental issues.

Practical

We will serve pizza and beverages at around 5 PM before the presentation. Please let me know if any of you have any food-allergies that need to be taken into consideration.

Organized in cooperation with Semantic Technologies Meetup: https://www.meetup.com/semantictechnologies/events/244679531/

events.name: Firebase – moderne app-utvikling på Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
Møt Dan McGrath - en nøkkelperson i produktteamet bak Firebase i Google. Ikke gå glipp av denne unike mulighet til å høre om moderne app utvikling, innovasjon hos Google og hvordan Cloud Firestore passer inn i denne historien. Ta app-utvikling til et nytt nivå!

Firebase er Googles mobil og webapplikasjonsutviklingsplattform som forenkler administrering av infrastrukturen og lar deg fokusere på brukeren. Nyeste tilskudd er Cloud Firestore, en ny dokument-database som lar deg enkelt lagre og synkronisere appdata til skyen, selv i sanntid. Les mer her: https://firebase.google.com/

Dan McGrath er produktsjef for ulike distribuerte databaser i Google Cloud, inkludert nylanserte Cloud Firestore. Dan er en teknologientusiast som har brukt det siste tiåret til å jobbe med store databasesystemer og siden 2014 jobbet i Google med skybaserte løsninger. Han har bakgrunn fra banksystemarkitektur, databaser og informasjonssikkerhet. I foredraget vil han snakke om nettopp det å utforske moderne app utvikling, innovasjon på Google og hvordan Cloud Firestore passer inn i denne historien.

Agenda

[masked]: Registrering og enkel servering av mat og drikke
[masked]: "Modern Application Development & Cloud Firestore" - Dan McGrath, Google
[masked]: Spørsmål og diskusjon

Påmelding

http://computas.com/meetup

events.name: [External] Google Cloud OnBoard - Oslo
events.description:
GDG Cloud is not hosting this event, Google is.

Cloud OnBoard Oslo is a step-by-step Google Cloud Platform (GCP) technical training from our certified instructors. Through a combination of presentations, demos, and lab walk-throughs, this training has been designed to help you understand and get started with data tools such as Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Dataproc, BigQuery, TensorFlow, and ML APIs.

This free-to-attend, one-day event will provide you with industry best practices and tips to accelerate your learning and ability to design solutions with the Google Cloud Platform.

Attendees who participate in all of the modules will be provided with a Recognition of Participation.

Join us to accelerate your career with GCP by registering below. Please note this training is designed for technical professionals.

REGISTER HERE: https://goo.gl/7Aa8Q9

• What to bring
Laptops.

• Important to know
Note: Follow the link in the description for external registration.

events.name: Increasing Observability with Distributed Tracing
events.description:
We are excited to present a talk about OpenTracing – a vendor-neutral open standard for distributed tracing – a talk that should be relevant to everyone working with Cloud (independent of the cloud provider), or for anyone working with distributed systems in general.

This talk is presented to you in cooperation with CNCF Oslo group: https://www.meetup.com/Cloud-Native-and-Kubernetes-Oslo/.

The talk will be held at the Google's Oslo office (entrance is from Bryggegata, just between Starbucks and H&M). There will be food and drinks served before the presentation.

Outline:

- Introduction to Observability
- Notes about Logging, FluentD, OKLog
- Notes about Metrics, Prometheus

- Distributed Tracing
- OpenTracing API
- Integration with Tracing Infrastructure, Jaeger, Zipkin
- Black-Box Tracing, Apache Skywalking

- What’s next: LDFI, Intuition Engineering

Abstract:
Having the power to answer questions not only about general, high-level concerns like if an application is up and running and what is the average or 99-percentile response time, but really drill-down and answer more specific questions, like what has happened with an specific message or transaction and how components behave, becomes critical when applications are deployed to production. The ability to achieve this becomes more complex when components scale and get distributed across a cluster and messages are not anymore in only one platform. Distributed Tracing is a mechanism to track request-bounded behaviour across different, distributed components, propagating context between them and enable traces aggregation and analyze how components behave along each transaction. Tracing, as related methods like Logging and Metrics, help us to increase the level of observability that we have around our applications.

This presentation is aim to introduce practices to increase Observability using Logging, Metrics, and Tracing. Then, it will explain how to instrument applications with OpenTracing API and how to integrate with different tracing infrastructures like JaegerTracing and OpenZipkin. Finally, it will show some areas of study that are getting developed based on information generated by tracing.

Speaker:
Jorge Quilcate is software engineer, part of the Middleware team in Sysco AS, doing back-end development and data integration. Jorge is also blog writer and an open-source contributor (e.g. Apache Kafka project), currently focusing on reactive systems, scalable and distributed platforms and observability.

events.name: Dynamically scaling your build server with Kubernetes
events.description:
In a large development project, it may be beneficial to share resources amongst individual teams, for instance, the build server, artifact repository, or code quality system.

The challenge arises when the number of project participants is growing fast, and thus also the load on common infrastructure systems. A common solution to this is to allocate more compute resources, but what if we could rather allocate their resources on demand?

In this presentation, we'll investigate one solution that utilizes Kubernetes to avoid long queues on the build server. In addition, we'll see how one can dynamically scale the Kubernetes cluster on Google Cloud Platform to reduce costs during low periods of activity, but also handle bursts in traffic in a satisfactory manner.

Lastly, I'll share some of the experiences we've had with such a solution and some of the things you should look out for if you wish to do something similar.

Speaker:
Lars Martin Pedersen is a passionate full-stack developer that enjoys a challenge and likes to be involved in every technical part of a project.
Fairly recently he was appointed the task of being responsible for Cloud OPS in his team, and he would like to share some of the insights of his experiences with you.

events.name: Apache Airflow og Apache Beam
events.description:
[This particular talk will be held in Norwegian.]

Apache Beam er fantastisk til å gjøre transformasjoner av data, men plattformen mangler et godt scheduleringsverktøy.

Skal man ha flere jobber, med avhengigheter til andre jobber, blir det fort mye scripting og uoversiktlig.

I denne presentasjonen vil vi se på hvordan Apache Airflow og managed Apache Beam (Google Dataflow) kan spille på lag for å løse disse problemene.

Eksempler og kode som blir presentert vil være i Python.

---------
Foredragsholder: Anders Elton.

Anders Elton is a passionate full-stack developer that enjoys a challenge and likes to be involved in every technical part of a project. He enjoys finding insight and treasures in operational data.

In the last year Anders has worked with onboarding several customers to the Cloud, and he would like to share some insight and experiences on how to solve data ingestion and job orchestration, using the tools available to GCP.

events.name: Helsedata i skyen med Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
=== Hvordan gjør man helsedata tilgjengelig enkelt og sikkert?

I Norge er vi så heldige at vi har tilgang til allmenn offentlig helsebehandling, og helsesektoren følger oss alle fra krybbe til grav. På veien registreres det masse digitale helsedata om deg og meg.

Disse dataene vil vi ikke skal komme på avveie, og derfor er de som oftest låst ned lokalt hos hvert helseforetak, med strenge krav og retningslinjer for innsyn. Dette er i utgangspunktet bra, men samtidig er helsedataene våre en gullgruve med informasjon som vi i dag ikke får brukt noe særlig. Både forskere, som forsøker å finne bedre måter å forebygge og kurere sykdommene våre, og helseledere, som forsøker å holde oss mest mulig friske for skattekronene vi betaler, kunne gjort en mye bedre jobb hvis de hadde bedre tilgang til helsedata.

Er det mulig å høste forsknings og beslutningsgrunnlags -gevinstene, ved å enklere kunne sammenstille og analysere våre helsedata, uten at det går på bekostning av personvern og sikkerhet?

Dette er problemet som Direktoratet for e-helse forsøker å løse med prosjektet Helseanalyseplattformen. For å få bedre innsikt i hvilke muligheter som finnes ved å ta i bruk skyteknologi, utlyste de en konkurranse i vår, hvor ulike leverandører kunne være med å vise frem sitt forslag til løsning. Det eneste kravet var at man måtte vise frem kjørende kode, ikke bare diagrammer med bokser og piler!

En av de som tok utfordringer var Teodor fra Computas. I løpet av et par uker lagde han og en annen utvikler fra Computas en konseptløsning som viser hvordan man kan bruke Google Cloud Platform (GCP) til å samle inn, anonymisere, sammenstille og analysere helsedata.

Bli med å hør om historien om hvordan man lager en konseptløsning på GCP!

=== Om Teodor Ande Elstad

Teodor er seniorutvikler hos Computas. Han har jobbet mye med automatisering, og var blant annet med på å utvikle løsningen “UDI Auto”, som fatter innvandringsvedtak hos Utlendingsdirektoratet (https://www.aftenposten.no/norge/i/3jgrLe/Dataprogram-hos-UDI-gir-familier-opphold-i-Norge) For tiden jobber han med automatisk identifisering av feil i nettverket til de nye automatiske strømmålerene hos Hafslund. På fritiden er han mest glad i å pusle med musikk og rare programmeringsspråk.
events.how_to_find_us: Bygget er ved Egertorget og det står Computas på bygget. Inngangen er fra Akersgata og adressen er Akersgata 35-39. Det vil stå instruksjoner på døren. Vi skal være i 7. et, i kantina.

events.name: Hva har Open Source, Java, Data Pipelines og data fra Oslo Bysykkel til felles?
events.description:
Using Open Source Tech to Swap Out Components of Your Data Pipeline

A few years ago, moving data between applications and datastores included expensive monolithic stacks from large software vendors with little flexibility. Now with frameworks such as Apache Beam and Apache Airflow, we can schedule and run data processing jobs for both streaming and batch with the same underlying code. This presentation demonstrates the concepts of how this can glue your applications together and shows how we can run a data pipeline from Apache Kafka through Hadoop Flink to Hive and move this to Pub/Sub, Dataflow, and BigQuery by changing a few lines of Java in our Apache Beam code.

===Speaker:===
Rustam Mehmandarov
https://twitter.com/rmehmandarov

Passionate computer scientist. Leader of JavaZone. Frequent speaker. Java Champion.

upcoming.name: Firestore Hands-on Workshop
upcoming.description:
Do you want to create a real-time app that can be updated for all users in a few hundred milliseconds? A website that can simultaneously scale to millions of users without slowing down, while allowing you to upload as much data as you want without compromising performance?

Join this workshop and get the chance to learn how to use the latest Firebase component – Cloud Firestore!

==Description==
This is a workshop for those who want to learn the basics of Firebase's database service – Cloud Firestore. The workshop provides a good and basic introduction to what Firestore is and how you can use it in your own projects.

You can think of Firebase as Google Cloud Lite, with lots of cool features, that are easy to grasp and learn. During this workshop we will create a website where you can see restaurants, as well as being able to search for one specific restaurant and post reviews, with live updates!

==Practical Info==
* There will be food and soft drinks!
* The workshop will last for 2 hours. It will consist of 20 min intro talk, followed by the practical part. We will be there to assist you.
* Bring a PC, get a Google user, and login to firebase.com
* Make sure you have installed: git, node, and npm
* The initial code will be posted on GitHub. All you need to do is to clone it and run npm install
